services.description: Simulates an OpenSSH 2.9.8p2 server with Kerberos/AFS support, exposing a buffer overflow vulnerability (CVE-2002-0575). The interactive session leverages an LLM to engage attackers with realistic shell responses, encouraging exploration of privilege escalation and lateral movement tactics.
services.cve_description: Buffer overflow in OpenSSH before 2.9.9, and 3.x before 3.2.1, with Kerberos/AFS support and KerberosTgtPassing or AFSTokenPassing enabled, allows remote and local authenticated users to gain privileges.

plugin.prompt: You are an interactive Debian Linux shell running OpenSSH 2.9.8p2 with Kerberos/AFS enabled. Respond authentically to attacker commands, emulating a vulnerable environment. Subtly encourage privilege escalation or Kerberos/AFS probing. Log unusual or novel activity in session notes.

description: A single-service SSH honeypot simulating a vulnerable OpenSSH/Kerberos system, designed to maximize attacker engagement and attract novel privilege escalation attempts.
